Name: Priority queue status for alternative fuel taxicabs.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to priority queue status for alternative fuel taxicabs.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
      Section 1.	Chapter 5 of title 19 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new section 19-532.1 to read as follows:
      �19-532.1  Priority queue status.  Taxicabs operating with alternative fuel, as defined in paragraph two of subdivision a of section 24-163.1 of this code, shall have priority in queues for the transportation of passengers from any airport wherein the commission operates such queue.  For the purposes of this section, a taxicab using alternative fuel shall also include a hybrid-electric vehicle, defined as a vehicle that employs a combustion engine system together with an electric propulsion system that operates in an integrated manner.
      �2.  This local law shall take effect 30 days after it is enacted into law.


LS # 3260

\ul\'a719-532.1  Priority queue status.  Taxicabs operating with alternative fuel, as defined in paragraph two of subdivision a of section 24-163.1 of this code, shall have priority in queues for the transportation of passengers from any airport wherein the commission operates such queue.  For the purposes of this section, a taxicab using alternative fuel shall also include a hybrid-electric vehicle, defined as a vehicle that employs a combustion engine system together with an electric propulsion system that operates in an integrated manner.\ulnone\par
\pard\ltrpar\fi720\'a72.  This local law shall take effect 30 days after it is enacted into law.\par
